contentList.content: Dodge
Focus on defending yourself and avoiding incoming strikes. Attacks against you are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> until the start of your next turn.
Dwarven Fortitude

Prerequisite: Dwarf
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Whenever you take the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dodge">Dodge</LSTag> action during combat, you can regain a number of hit points equal to your Hit Die + your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> (minimum of 1).

Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Whenever you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on your chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag>, you can reroll one of the dice.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to cold damage and poison damage. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="POISONED">Poison</LSTag>.

Flames Of Phlegethos

Prerequisite: Tiefling
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When you <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">roll</LSTag> fire damage for a spell you cast, you can reroll the fire damage dice, but you must use the new roll.
Whenever you cast a spell that deals fire damage, you can wrap yourself in an <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="Fire_Aura">Aura of Fire</LSTag>.
Squat Nimbleness

Prerequisite: Dwarf or a Small race
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by 5 feet. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in the <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag> skill. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on any Athletics or Acrobatics check you make to escape from being <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag>.
Everybody's Friend

Prerequisite: Half-Elf
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Deception">Deception</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Persuasion">Persuasion</LSTag>. If you’re already proficient in either skill, your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> is doubled for any check you make with that skill.
Lucky Feat

You gain 3 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="LuckPoint">Luck Points</LSTag>. Whenever you make an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can spend one luck point to roll an additional d20. You can also spend one luck point when an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> is made against you. In combat you activate your luck. Until your next turn you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on attack rolls, ability checks or saving throws.
Your enemies have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on their attack rolls against you. If more than one creature spends a luck point to influence the outcome of a roll, the points cancel each other out; no additional dice are rolled. You regain your expended luck points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Luck Points

Until your next turn you have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">advantage</LsTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Your enemies have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on their attack rolls against you. You regain your expended luck points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Your attacks and spells ignore <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to poison damage. You can coat a weapon in poison as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>.
You are able to use a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Summon_PoisonersKit">Poisoner's Kit</LSTag>.

Poisoner's Kit. Combine with items to create poisons and other items. PoisonerKit + Basic Poison = Wyvern Poison; PoisonerKit + Wyvern Poison = Drow Poison; PoisonerKit + Healing Potion = Basic Poison (2), + Greater Healing = Basic Poison (4)

You learn one Druid <LSTag Tooltip="Cantrip">cantrip</LSTag> of your choice. You also learn <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Longstrider">Longstrider</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_PassWithoutTrace">Pass Without Trace</LSTag>, each of which you can cast once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbility">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> for all 3 spells is Wisdom.

Choose one skill in which you have proficiency. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Expertise">Expertise</LSTag> with that skill. The skill you choose must be one that isn't already benefiting from a feature, such as Expertise, that doubles your proficiency bonus.

Second Chance

Prerequisite: Halfling Fortune favors you when someone tries to strike you. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
When a creature you can see hits you with an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to force that creature to reroll. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until you roll initiative at the start of combat or until you finish a short or long rest.
Orcish Fury

Prerequisite: Half-orc
Your fury burns tirelessly. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, up to a maximum of 20.
When you hit with a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attack</LSTag> you can roll one of the weapon’s damage dice an additional time and add it as extra damage of the weapon’s damage type. Once you use this ability, you can’t use it again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Immediately after you use your <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="RelentlessEndurance">Relentless Endurance</LSTag>, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to make one weapon attack.
When you hit with a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Melee Weapon Attack</LSTag> deal additional [1]
When you hit with a <LSTag Tooltip="RangedWeaponAttack">Ranged Weapon Attack</LSTag> deal additional [1]
Artificer Initiate

You’ve learned some of an artificer’s inventiveness:
You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Artificer spell list, and you learn one 1st-level spell of your choice from that list. It uses your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> as its <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">modifier</LSTag>. You can cast this feat's 1st-level spell without a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag>, and you must finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> before you can cast it in this way again. You can also cast the spell using any <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slots</LSTag> you have. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> with one type of artisan's tools of your choice, and you can use that type of tool as a spellcasting focus for any spell you cast that uses <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> as its spellcasting ability.

Absorb elemental damage once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Take half damage from the next elemental attack targetting you, and deal an additional [1] of that element type on your next attack.
Fade Away

Prerequisite: Gnome
Your people are clever, with a knack for illusion magic. You have learned a magical trick for fading away when you suffer harm. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your Dexterity or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Immediately after you take damage, you can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to magically become <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Invisibility">Invisible</LSTag> until the end of your next turn or until you attack, deal damage, or force someone to make a saving throw. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Remarkable Recovery

Your body has the ability to recover quickly from terrible injuries, and is unusually receptive to healing magic. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. When you are successfully stabilized while dying, you regain <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier (minimum of 1). Whenever you regain <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> as a result of a spell, potion, or class feature (but not this feat), you regain additional hit points equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> modifier (minimum of 1).
Svirfneblin Magic

Prerequisite: Gnome (Deep Gnome)
You have inherited the innate spellcasting ability of your ancestors. This ability allows you to cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Nondetection">Nondetection</LSTag> on yourself at will, without needing a material component.
You can also cast each of the following spells once with this ability: <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Blindness">Blindness</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Blur">Blur</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_DisguiseSelf">Disguise Self</LSTag>. You regain the ability to cast these spells when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> is your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">modifier</LSTag>for these spells
Chef

Time and effort spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off. You gain the following benefits:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. You gain <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with cook’s utensils if you don’t already have it. As part of a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. At the end of the <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra 1d8 hit points. With one hour of work or when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you can cook a number of treats equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> to eat one of those treats to gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Cook Special Food

As part of a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, you can cook special food, provided you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand. You can prepare enough of this food for a number of creatures equal to 4 + your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. At the end of the <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>, any creature who eats the food and spends one or more Hit Dice to regain hit points regains an extra hit points.
Cook Special Treats

With one hour of work or when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>, you can cook a number of treats equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. These special treats last 8 hours after being made. A creature can use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag> to eat one of those treats to gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>.
Once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> you can summon food, lasting until a long rest. When consumed and the character takes a short rest they regain an extra 1d8 hit points.

Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> you can summon food, lasting until a long rest. Once consumed the character gains <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>

Bountiful Luck: AttackRoll

Prerequisite: Halfling
Your people have extraordinary luck, which you have learned to mystically lend to your companions whenever you see them falter. You're not sure how you do it, you just wish it, and it happens. Surely a sign of fortune's favor!
When an ally you can see within 30 feet of you rolls a 1 on the d20 for an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, an <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Check</LSTag>, or a <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>, you can use your reaction to let the ally reroll the die. The ally must use the new roll. When you use this ability, you can't use your Lucky racial trait before the end of your next turn

Guile of the Cloud Giant

Source: Bigby Presents - Glory of the Giants
Prerequisite: 4th Level, Strike of the Giants (Cloud Strike) Feat
You’ve manifested the confounding magic emblematic of cloud giants, granting you the following benefits:
Ability Score Increase. Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag>, or <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20. Cloudy Escape.
